results.title: [Alexander Sinclair Home Movie Collection]
results.headline_credit: Australia, Papua New Guinea, United Kingdom and United States, 1960-1979
results.material_description: 9 x large & 5 x small Super-8mm reels of home movie footage, labelled O/S & Pacific Island cruises, New Guinea, Ireland, "Messiah" etc
results.brief_description:
Alexander Sinclair (21 October 1918 – 3 May 1998) was an amateur filmmaker who lived in Papua New Guinea with his wife Evelyn Sinclair for approximately 20 years from 1959 onwards. They lived in Port Moresby for three years, followed by Goroka. He made home movies of life in Papua New Guinea and travels with Evelyn and their friends to the UK, the Netherlands, USA, Melbourne and Sydney throughout the 1960s and 1970s.

The collection of home movies, originally made on Super 8mm film, was donated to ACMI by their daughter Elizabeth Robbins.

results.title: [Air parade]
results.brief_description: Set behind-the-scenes of an American radio station in the 1940’s, this B-Grade melodrama revolves around the escapades of a scheming studio head and a troupe of radio performers aspiring towards stardom and success. The players include, Niela Goodelle, Lee Sullivan, Arthur Boran, Russ Brown, Clyde Fillmore, Edith Gresham, Marion Martin and Johnny Johnson’s Orchestra which is a typical dance band of the era.

results.title: [Adam Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
A passenger on the Murray River Queen gets into trouble when he falls off the ship and seemingly gets eaten by a large fish. Subsequently, the steamer loses oil which drips into the sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Accident service]
results.brief_description: The new conception of rehabilitation is shown through the study of the methods (circa 1945) used in treating and caring for injured miners at a well-known hospital and rehabilitation centre in the English Midlands. All stages of treatment are presented. Interesting from a historical viewpoint. NB: Contains some graphic images.

results.title: [ABC TV News: First Bulletin in Colour for 1st March, 1975]
results.brief_description:
Nearly 19 years after he presented the first ever ABC TV nightly news bulletin (on 5th November, 1956) newsreader James Dibble presents the first ever ABC TV news bulletin in colour.

In this bulletin, the news includes coverage of a serious rail accident in the London underground, ongoing conflict in Cambodia, and French nuclear testing in the South Pacific. A young Jeff McMullen investigates the U.S. amnesty program for draft resisters and deserters; while Jim Revitt reports on the progress of Darwin’s recovery following Cyclone Tracy.

constellations_other.name: Television and creative constraint
constellations_other.description: Making art for the screen is dependent on time, resources, and infrastructure. Where technology could have posed a barrier, these television producers saw an opportunity, instead.
